# xpc_connection_resume(_:)

**Function**

Resumes a suspended connection.

## Declaration

```swift
func xpc_connection_resume(_ connection: xpc_connection_t)
```

## Parameters

- **connection**: The connection object which is to be manipulated.

## Discussion

In order for a connection to become live, every call to [doc://com.apple.xpc/documentation/XPC/xpc_connection_suspend(_:)] must be balanced with a call to [doc://com.apple.xpc/documentation/XPC/xpc_connection_resume(_:)] after the initial call to [doc://com.apple.xpc/documentation/XPC/xpc_connection_resume(_:)]. After the initial resume of the connection, calling [doc://com.apple.xpc/documentation/XPC/xpc_connection_resume(_:)] more times than [doc://com.apple.xpc/documentation/XPC/xpc_connection_suspend(_:)] has been called is considered an error.

## Life cycle

- **xpc_main(_:)**: Starts listening for incoming connections and processes them with the specified event handler.
- **xpc_connection_activate(_:)**: Activates a new connection.
- **xpc_connection_suspend(_:)**: Suspends the connection so the event handler block doesn’t fire and the connection doesn’t attempt to send any messages it has in its queue.
- **xpc_connection_cancel(_:)**: Cancels the connection and ensures that its event handler doesn’t fire again.
- **xpc_transaction_begin()**: Informs the XPC runtime when a transaction begins, indicating that the service isn’t idle.
- **xpc_transaction_end()**: Informs the XPC runtime when a transaction ends.
- **xpc_connection_copy_invalidation_reason(_:)**
